awd_abstract_narration: They propose to measure the linewidth of phonons in the lattice                 phase of electrons on the surface of liquid helium to check the                 weak coupling theory of longitudinal phonon linewidths.  This                   theory predicts the linewidths to vary inversely with the phonon                frequency, and predicts the density and temperature dependence of               the linewidth.  A maximum in the linewidth is predicted at about                one-tenth the melting temperature.  This results from a reduction               in scattering at high temperatures due to the Debye-Waller                      factor.  The weak coupling approximation is expected to hold for                densities below 107/cm.  Their measurements should check the                    range of validity of this theory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
